issues.lineContent: <input type="email" placeholder="Your email address" required aria-label="Email address" />
issues.description: Form input lacks an explicitly associated <label>; relying on placeholder and aria-label may reduce usability and visible context.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible label associated with the input (e.g., <label htmlFor="newsletter-email">Email address</label>) and give the input an id (e.g., id="newsletter-email"); avoid relying solely on placeholder.

issues.description: Image alternative text is vague/redundant; if the image is decorative, it should have empty alt text.
issues.recommendation: If the image is decorative, set alt="" (and optionally aria-hidden="true"); if it conveys information, provide a more descriptive alt text that conveys the purpose.

issues.description: Custom tab interface lacks appropriate ARIA roles/states (no role="tablist", tabs not role="tab", missing aria-selected/aria-controls), so assistive technologies cannot reliably determine name, role, and state.
issues.recommendation: Implement the WAI-ARIA tab pattern: add role="tablist" to the container; use elements with role="tab" (preferably <button>) for each tab with aria-selected and aria-controls linking to a panel with role="tabpanel"; manage focus and keyboard (arrow keys) per the pattern.

issues.description:
Non-semantic element (

) used as an interactive control (button) breaks semantic structure and can confuse assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Use a semantic <button> element for clickable controls (or <button role="tab"> when implementing tabs) and style it as needed. Retain keyboard handlers only if required for custom behavior.

issues.lineContent: <h4 onClick={() => handleAddToCart(product)} role="button" tabIndex={0} aria-label="Add to cart" onKeyDown={(e) => (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') && handleAddToCart(product)}>
issues.description: Heading element (<h4>) used as a button. Using headings for actions breaks document structure and can create confusion for screen reader users.
issues.recommendation: Replace the heading with a semantic <button type="button">Add to Cart</button> and style it to match the design. Keep the accessible name and keyboard support.

issues.description: Non-semantic element (<div>) used as a button. Although role and keyboard handlers are provided, native semantics should be used for controls.
issues.recommendation: Use a semantic <button aria-label="Add to cart"> with the <FaCartPlus /> icon inside. This ensures proper semantics, focus, and activation behavior by default.

issues.description: Icon component used directly as an interactive control instead of a semantic button.
issues.recommendation: Wrap the icon in a <button> (or render as a button) with aria-pressed and an appropriate accessible name, e.g., <button aria-pressed={...} aria-label="Add to wishlist"> <FiHeart aria-hidden="true" /> </button>.

issues.description: Alt text is generic and does not convey the content or purpose of the image. If images are decorative, they should have empty alt text.
issues.recommendation: Provide meaningful alt text describing the image content/purpose (e.g., the subject of the photo). If purely decorative, use alt="" to avoid unnecessary verbosity for screen readers.

issues.description: Tabs provide visual feedback on hover only; no focus styles are defined for keyboard users, making focus not visibly apparent.
issues.recommendation: Add :focus and/or :focus-visible styles that mirror hover/active states and ensure the tab elements are keyboard focusable (e.g., use <button> or role="tab" with tabindex).

issues.description: Secondary product image is revealed on hover only, which is not operable via keyboard.
issues.recommendation: Mirror the hover behavior on :focus or :focus-within and ensure the interactive element is focusable (e.g., link or button) so keyboard users can trigger the same image swap.

issues.description: Underline indicator appears on hover only; there is no visible indicator on keyboard focus.
issues.recommendation: Add :focus and/or :focus-visible styles (on the actual interactive element such as the <a>) to provide an equivalent visual indicator when focused via keyboard.

issues.description: Gray foreground color on an element positioned over images may not meet the required 4.5:1 contrast ratio against variable backgrounds.
issues.recommendation: Use a higher-contrast color (e.g., #000) or add a solid background/high-contrast container behind the icon/text to ensure at least 4.5:1 contrast against underlying imagery.

issues.description: Inline links may be indistinguishable from surrounding text if only color (or no visual cue) is used to indicate link status.
issues.recommendation: Retain underlines for inline links or provide a non-color visual cue (e.g., underline, different font weight) and ensure visible focus styles so links are clearly identifiable.

issues.description: The 'Discover more' link removes the underline and relies on hover effects applied to a parent element, which may not clearly distinguish the link from surrounding text.
issues.recommendation: Provide a persistent non-color cue (e.g., underline) for the <a> itself, and add :focus/:focus-visible styles to ensure clear identification and focus indication for keyboard users.

issues.description: Product image has empty alt attribute; essential image lacks text alternative
issues.recommendation: Provide a descriptive alt text, e.g., alt={product.productName} or "Front view of [product name]"

issues.description: Link has no accessible name because it contains only images with empty alt text
issues.recommendation: Add visible link text or provide meaningful alt text for the images so the link purpose is clear (e.g., alt with product name)

issues.description: Form control is missing an associated label
issues.recommendation: Add a visible label element (e.g., <label htmlFor="sort">Sort by</label>) or use aria-label/aria-labelledby to provide an accessible name

issues.description: Non-interactive element with onClick is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use a semantic <button type="button"> with onClick and ensure it is focusable; add an accessible name like "Filter"

issues.description: Non-interactive element with onClick is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Replace with a <button type="button"> that toggles the filter drawer and provide an accessible name such as "Filter"

issues.description: Heading is used as a clickable control and is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use a <button type="button">Add to Cart</button> to ensure proper semantics and keyboard operability

issues.description: Custom clickable control (div with icon) lacks semantic role and accessible name
issues.recommendation: Render as a <button type="button" aria-label="Add to cart"> with the icon inside; ensure it is focusable and operable by keyboard

issues.description: Icon is used as a button without semantic role or accessible name
issues.recommendation: Use a <button type="button" aria-pressed={...} aria-label="Add to wishlist"/"Remove from wishlist"> and include the icon inside

issues.description: Wishlist state is indicated by color alone (red vs gray)
issues.recommendation: Provide a non-color indicator (e.g., change icon shape/fill, add text) and expose state via aria-pressed on a button

issues.description: Paragraph element used as an interactive control (Prev) is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use a <button type="button"> or <a href> with appropriate semantics and keyboard support; add aria-label like "Previous page"

issues.description: Paragraph used as pagination control is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use <button> or <a href> for pagination items and include aria-current="page" on the active page

issues.description: Paragraph used as pagination control is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use <button> or <a href> for pagination items and include aria-current="page" on the active page

issues.description: Paragraph used as pagination control is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use <button> or <a href> for pagination items and include aria-current="page" on the active page

issues.description: Paragraph used as pagination control is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use <button> or <a href> for pagination items and include aria-current="page" on the active page

issues.description: Paragraph element used as an interactive control (Next) is not keyboard accessible
issues.recommendation: Use a <button type="button"> or <a href> with appropriate semantics and keyboard support; add aria-label like "Next page"

issues.description: Icon used as a close control lacks semantic button role and accessible name
issues.recommendation: Use a <button type="button" aria-label="Close filters"> with the icon inside to ensure proper semantics and keyboard accessibility

issues.description: Custom drawer lacks appropriate role and accessible name
issues.recommendation: Add role="dialog" or role="complementary" with aria-labelledby referencing the header text (e.g., "Filter By"), and manage focus when opened/closed

issues.description: Star icons convey rating visually without a text alternative
issues.recommendation: Provide an accessible text alternative, e.g., add aria-label on the rating container like "5 out of 5 stars" and mark star icons aria-hidden="true"

issues.description: Duplicate id attribute value 'panel1-header' used on multiple elements
issues.recommendation: Use unique ids for each accordion header (e.g., 'panel-categories-header', 'panel-colors-header', etc.) or let the component library manage ids by removing the manual id.

issues.description: Duplicate id attribute value 'panel1-header' used on multiple elements
issues.recommendation: Use unique ids for each accordion header (e.g., 'panel-colors-header') or remove manual ids and rely on MUI’s built-in labelling.

issues.description: Duplicate id attribute value 'panel1-header' used on multiple elements
issues.recommendation: Assign unique id values for each AccordionSummary header to avoid duplicate IDs.

issues.description: Duplicate id attribute value 'panel1-header' used on multiple elements
issues.recommendation: Ensure each AccordionSummary has a unique id and matches the related content via aria-controls/aria-labelledby.

issues.description: Duplicate id attribute value 'panel1-header' used on multiple elements
issues.recommendation: Provide unique ids for each header or remove manual ids to let the component library manage them.

issues.description: aria-controls references a non-existent or duplicate id 'panel1-content'
issues.recommendation: Add a matching unique id to the controlled AccordionDetails (e.g., 'panel-categories-content') and update aria-controls to match, or remove manual aria-controls and allow MUI to manage relationships.

issues.description: aria-controls references a non-existent or duplicate id 'panel1-content'
issues.recommendation: Provide a unique id on the corresponding AccordionDetails and reference it from aria-controls.

issues.description: aria-controls references a non-existent or duplicate id 'panel1-content'
issues.recommendation: Ensure each accordion summary’s aria-controls points to a unique, existing id on its details panel.

issues.description: aria-controls references a non-existent or duplicate id 'panel1-content'
issues.recommendation: Create unique ids for each AccordionDetails element and update aria-controls accordingly, or remove the manual attributes.

issues.description: aria-controls references a non-existent or duplicate id 'panel1-content'
issues.recommendation: Link each summary to its content region with unique IDs, or rely on MUI’s automatic id management by removing these attributes.

issues.description:
List of categories is marked up with

elements instead of semantic list structure
issues.recommendation: Use semantic list markup (<ul> with <li>) to represent lists of items.

issues.description: Color selection buttons have non-descriptive labels (hex codes) that are not meaningful to users of assistive technologies
issues.recommendation: Provide human-readable color names in aria-label (e.g., 'Select blue') or include visually hidden text naming the color.

issues.description: Related checkboxes (brand filters) are not grouped with a fieldset and legend to convey relationship
issues.recommendation: Wrap the brand checkboxes in a <fieldset> with an appropriate <legend> (e.g., 'Brands') to programmatically convey grouping.

issues.description: Non-descriptive link text 'Shop Now' without programmatically determinable context
issues.recommendation: Make the link purpose clear by changing the visible text to something like 'Shop Men’s Sportswear' or add an aria-label/aria-labelledby that includes the context.

issues.description: Heading element used for non-heading content (wrapping a call-to-action link)
issues.recommendation:
Use a semantic element such as

or

for styling the call-to-action; reserve heading tags for section headings.

issues.description: Heading element used for non-heading content (wrapping a call-to-action link)
issues.recommendation:
Use a semantic element such as

or

for styling the call-to-action; reserve heading tags for section headings.

issues.description: Heading structure is not hierarchical (h6 precedes h3), which may impair navigation by headings
issues.recommendation: Use headings in a logical order (e.g., h2 followed by h3) or use non-heading elements for non-structural text like pricing to maintain a clear hierarchy.

issues.description: Heading structure is not hierarchical (h6 precedes h3) in this section, which may impair navigation by headings
issues.recommendation: Adjust heading levels to follow a logical sequence, and avoid using headings purely for visual styling; use non-heading elements for non-structural text.

issues.description: Numeric countdown value is marked up as a heading, which is not an actual section heading and misuses semantic structure.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-heading element (e.g., <span> or <div>) for the numeric value and reserve headings for actual section titles. Maintain association with the label via aria-labelledby on a grouping container if needed.

issues.description: Numeric countdown value is marked up as a heading, which is not an actual section heading and misuses semantic structure.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-heading element (e.g., <span> or <div>) for the numeric value and reserve headings for actual section titles. Maintain association with the label via aria-labelledby on a grouping container if needed.

issues.description: Numeric countdown value is marked up as a heading, which is not an actual section heading and misuses semantic structure.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-heading element (e.g., <span> or <div>) for the numeric value and reserve headings for actual section titles. Maintain association with the label via aria-labelledby on a grouping container if needed.

issues.description: Numeric countdown value is marked up as a heading, which is not an actual section heading and misuses semantic structure.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-heading element (e.g., <span> or <div>) for the numeric value and reserve headings for actual section titles. Maintain association with the label via aria-labelledby on a grouping container if needed.

issues.description: Punctuation is marked up as a heading solely for visual styling, which misuses heading semantics.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-semantic element such as : for punctuation and style it with CSS instead of using a heading element.

issues.description: Punctuation is marked up as a heading solely for visual styling, which misuses heading semantics.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-semantic element such as : for punctuation and style it with CSS instead of using a heading element.

issues.description: Punctuation is marked up as a heading solely for visual styling, which misuses heading semantics.
issues.recommendation: Use a non-semantic element such as : for punctuation and style it with CSS instead of using a heading element.

issues.lineContent: <input type="email" placeholder="Email address *" aria-label="Email address" required />
issues.description: Form input is missing an associated <label> element; relying solely on placeholder/aria-label can reduce clarity and programmatic association.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> linked via htmlFor/id (e.g., <label htmlFor="email">Email address</label> and <input id="email" ... />). Keep aria-label only if a visible label cannot be provided.

issues.description: Form input is missing an associated <label> element; relying solely on placeholder/aria-label can reduce clarity and programmatic association.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> linked via htmlFor/id (e.g., <label htmlFor="password">Password</label> and <input id="password" ... />). Keep aria-label only if a visible label cannot be provided.

issues.description: Form input is missing an associated <label> element; relying solely on placeholder/aria-label can reduce clarity and programmatic association.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> linked via htmlFor/id (e.g., <label htmlFor="username">Username</label> and <input id="username" ... />). Keep aria-label only if a visible label cannot be provided.

issues.lineContent: <input type="email" placeholder="Email address *" aria-label="Email address" required />
issues.description: Form input is missing an associated <label> element; relying solely on placeholder/aria-label can reduce clarity and programmatic association.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> linked via htmlFor/id (e.g., <label htmlFor="register-email">Email address</label> and <input id="register-email" ... />). Keep aria-label only if a visible label cannot be provided.

issues.description: Form input is missing an associated <label> element; relying solely on placeholder/aria-label can reduce clarity and programmatic association.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> linked via htmlFor/id (e.g., <label htmlFor="register-password">Password</label> and <input id="register-password" ... />). Keep aria-label only if a visible label cannot be provided.

issues.description: Link is identified by color alone (underline removed), which can make it indistinguishable from surrounding text for some users.
issues.recommendation: Retain the default underline for links or add a non-color visual cue (e.g., underline on focus/hover) to ensure links are distinguishable without relying solely on color.

issues.description: No heading structure is present to describe the page or sections, which hampers navigation for assistive technology users.
issues.recommendation:
Add a descriptive top-level heading (e.g.,

Login

or

Account Access

) and appropriate section headings for the Login and Register panels.

issues.lineContent: <input type="email" placeholder="Email address *" required aria-label="Email address" aria-describedby="reset-instructions" autocomplete="email" />
issues.description: Form control does not have a visible label and relies on placeholder text, which can reduce clarity and usability.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible label associated to the input using for/id (e.g., <label for="email">Email address</label> and <input id="email" ... />). Keep aria-describedby for supplemental instructions.

issues.description: Page is missing a descriptive title; no <title> is set for this view.
issues.recommendation: Set a descriptive page title for this route (e.g., using document.title in a useEffect or a <Helmet><title>Terms & Conditions</title></Helmet> component).

issues.description: Top-level page heading uses <h2> instead of <h1>, which may disrupt the logical heading structure if no <h1> exists on the page.
issues.recommendation: Use <h1> for the main page title within the main region, or ensure an <h1> is present earlier in the DOM and adjust subsequent headings accordingly.

issues.description: No skip link is provided to bypass repetitive navigation
issues.recommendation: Add a visible on focus 'Skip to main content' link before the navigation that targets the main content landmark (e.g., Skip to main content) and ensure the main region has id="main"

issues.description: Linked image alt text 'Logo' does not clearly describe the link purpose (likely the homepage)
issues.recommendation: Use more descriptive alt text for the linked logo such as 'Home' or the brand name (e.g., alt="ACME Home") so the link purpose is clear

issues.description: Linked image alt text 'Logo' does not clearly describe the link purpose (likely the homepage)
issues.recommendation: Use more descriptive alt text for the linked logo such as 'Home' or the brand name (e.g., alt="ACME Home") so the link purpose is clear

issues.description: Link accessible name 'Search' does not describe its destination (/shop), which can confuse screen reader users
issues.recommendation: Ensure the link text/aria-label accurately reflects the destination (e.g., change aria-label to 'Shop') or make it a true search action button if it is intended to submit a search

issues.description: Click handler is attached to a non-interactive icon inside a link; keyboard activation of the link will not trigger this handler, leading to inconsistent behavior (e.g., mobile menu may not close and page may remain non-scrollable)
issues.recommendation: Move the onClick handler to the Link element so it fires on keyboard activation as well (or additionally handle closing the menu/resetting body overflow on route change). Example: <Link to="/shop" onClick={toggleMobileMenu} aria-label="Shop">

issues.description: Input field removes the default focus indicator with no custom visible focus style
issues.recommendation: Restore a visible focus indicator (e.g., remove outline: none; and/or add a custom :focus style with sufficient contrast such as outline: 2px solid #000 or a clear box-shadow)

issues.description: Select element removes the default focus indicator with no custom visible focus style
issues.recommendation: Provide a visible focus style for the select (e.g., outline or box-shadow on :focus) instead of removing it

issues.description: Select element removes the default focus indicator with no custom visible focus style
issues.recommendation: Provide a visible focus style for the select (e.g., outline or box-shadow on :focus) instead of removing it

issues.description: Multiple navigation regions are present without an accessible name, which can make it harder for assistive technology users to distinguish them
issues.recommendation: Add aria-label or aria-labelledby to each <nav> to describe its purpose (e.g., <nav className="navBar" aria-label="Primary navigation">)

issues.description: Navigation region lacks an accessible name, which can make it harder for assistive technology users to distinguish multiple nav landmarks
issues.recommendation: Add aria-label (e.g., aria-label="Mobile navigation") or aria-labelledby to identify this navigation region

issues.description: Paragraph content is marked up as a heading (h4), misrepresenting document structure
issues.recommendation:
Use a

element for paragraph text and reserve heading tags for actual section headings; apply styles via CSS

issues.description: Heading level may not reflect a logical hierarchy (h5 used for a top/peer section heading, skipping levels)
issues.recommendation: Use a heading level appropriate to the section hierarchy (e.g., h2 or h3) to maintain a logical, nested structure

issues.description: Carousel lacks keyboard-operable controls; users cannot navigate through slides using the keyboard, especially at smaller viewports where only one slide is visible
issues.recommendation: Provide keyboard-accessible previous/next controls and/or enable Swiper's keyboard and accessibility modules; ensure slides can be navigated with the keyboard and announce the carousel with appropriate roles

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text for brand logo; does not convey the brand name or purpose
issues.recommendation: Replace alt text with the actual partner brand name (e.g., "Acme logo") or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Main page heading uses h2 instead of h1, which can disrupt heading hierarchy for assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Use an h1 element for the main page title or ensure heading levels are sequential and start with h1.

issues.description: Categories are visually presented as a set of items/tabs but are coded as paragraph elements, not as a semantic list or interactive controls.
issues.recommendation: Mark up the categories as a semantic list (ul/li). If they are selectable filters/tabs, use buttons or links with appropriate semantics and aria-current to indicate the active item.

issues.description: Collection of blog posts is rendered with generic divs rather than semantic list or article elements, which may obscure relationships for assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Use a semantic list (ul/li) for the collection or use article elements for each post to better convey structure.

issues.lineContent: <button className="blogListShowMore" onClick={scrollToTop} type="button" aria-label="Show more blog posts">
issues.description: Button’s accessible label "Show more blog posts" does not accurately describe its action, which only scrolls to top.
issues.recommendation: Update the label to reflect the actual action (e.g., "Scroll to top") or implement functionality that loads more posts to match the label.

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text that does not convey the image content
issues.recommendation: Provide meaningful alt text describing the image, or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: Non-descriptive alt text that does not convey the image content
issues.recommendation: Provide meaningful alt text describing the image, or use alt="" if the image is purely decorative

issues.description: White text on the Twitter button background (#1da1f2) yields insufficient contrast (~2.8:1)
issues.recommendation: Increase contrast by using a darker text color (e.g., #000 on #1da1f2) or darken the background color so white text achieves at least 4.5:1

issues.description: White text on the Twitter hover background (#0d95e8) likely has insufficient contrast (<4.5:1)
issues.recommendation: Ensure the hover state also meets contrast by using a darker text color or a darker hover background

issues.description:
Block-level

element inside a
issues.recommendation:
Replace

with a or plain text inside the

issues.description:
Block-level

element inside a
issues.recommendation:
Replace

with a or plain text inside the

issues.description: Click handler on non-interactive element (ul) without role or keyboard support
issues.recommendation: Avoid attaching onClick to non-interactive elements. Move the handler to the Link elements or handle scroll on route change. If interaction is needed on the container, add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space.

issues.description: Click handler on non-interactive element (ul) without role or keyboard support
issues.recommendation: Avoid attaching onClick to non-interactive elements. Move the handler to the Link elements or handle scroll on route change. If interaction is needed on the container, add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space.

issues.description: Click handler on non-interactive element (ul) without role or keyboard support
issues.recommendation: Avoid attaching onClick to non-interactive elements. Move the handler to the Link elements or handle scroll on route change. If interaction is needed on the container, add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space.

issues.description: Link relies on color alone for identification within a paragraph (underline removed)
issues.recommendation: Provide a non-color visual cue for links (e.g., underline) or use consistent styling that includes underlines for normal and focus states to ensure links are distinguishable without relying on color alone.

issues.description: Text input lacks an associated visible <label> element.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> element and associate it to the input using htmlFor and a matching id. Keep aria-label only if necessary but ensure a persistent visible label.

issues.description: Email input lacks an associated visible <label> element.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> element and associate it to the input using htmlFor and a matching id. Keep aria-label only if necessary but ensure a persistent visible label.

issues.description: Textarea lacks an associated visible <label> element.
issues.recommendation: Add a visible <label> element and associate it to the textarea using htmlFor and a matching id. Keep aria-label only if necessary but ensure a persistent visible label.

issues.description: Focus indicator is not clearly distinguishable because the outline is applied in all states, not specifically on focus.
issues.recommendation: Provide a distinct focus style (e.g., using :focus and :focus-visible) that visibly differs from the unfocused state, such as a high-contrast outline or box-shadow.

issues.description: Focus indicator for textarea is not clearly distinguishable because the outline is applied in all states, not specifically on focus.
issues.recommendation: Add clear focus-specific styles (e.g., :focus/:focus-visible) that change the outline or add a high-contrast focus ring to make focus obvious.

issues.description: Button focus indicator may be imperceptible against a white page background and is applied in all states, making keyboard focus hard to perceive.
issues.recommendation: Use focus-specific styles (e.g., :focus/:focus-visible) with a high-contrast outline or box-shadow that is clearly visible against the surrounding background.

issues.description: Page does not set a descriptive document title
issues.recommendation: Set a descriptive page title for the 404 page (e.g., using document.title or a head manager like React Helmet to 'Page not found')

issues.description: Heading text is not descriptive and does not convey the topic or purpose
issues.recommendation: Use a more descriptive subheading (e.g., 'We couldn't find that page') or remove the heading if it does not add structure

issues.description: Line break used for visual formatting instead of structural markup
issues.recommendation:
Avoid using
for layout; split the sentence into separate paragraphs or control spacing with CSS

issues.lineContent: <Link to="/" aria-label="Go back to home page">Go Back</Link>
issues.description: Link text 'Go Back' is ambiguous and may not clearly describe the destination without relying on nearby context
issues.recommendation: Use a more descriptive visible link text such as 'Go to Home Page' so the destination is clear from the link text alone; align aria-label with the visible text if used

issues.description: Text is placed over a background image, which may reduce contrast and make text hard to read
issues.recommendation: Ensure sufficient contrast (at least 4.5:1 for normal text) by adding a solid background or overlay behind text, or setting text color and background to guarantee contrast

issues.description: Interactive control (<button>) nested inside a link (<Link>), which is invalid HTML and can cause unexpected behavior for assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Do not nest interactive elements. Replace the inner <button> with a styled <Link>, or use a <button> that handles navigation without wrapping it in a link.

issues.description: Table footer content is not structured properly; cells are placed directly inside <tfoot> without a wrapping <tr>.
issues.recommendation: Wrap footer cells in a inside , e.g., … and avoid using header cells for non-header content.

issues.description: Empty table header cell provides no information about the column for assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Provide meaningful header text, or use <td> for non-header columns. If the column is purely decorative, consider using <td> with aria-hidden="true" on interactive elements within.

issues.description: Empty table header cell provides no information about the column for assistive technologies.
issues.recommendation: Provide meaningful header text, or use <td> for non-header columns. If the column is purely decorative, consider using <td> with aria-hidden="true" on interactive elements within.

issues.description: Focus indicator removed for inputs in quantity control, making it difficult for keyboard users to know which element is focused.
issues.recommendation: Do not remove focus outlines. Provide a visible custom focus style (e.g., using :focus with a 2px solid outline or box-shadow) that meets contrast requirements.

issues.description: Focus indicator removed for inputs in the coupon form.
issues.recommendation: Retain default focus outlines or add a custom visible :focus style (e.g., outline: 2px solid #000 or an equivalent high-contrast indicator).

issues.description: Focus indicator removed for <select> elements in checkout details.
issues.recommendation: Provide visible focus styles for <select> elements (e.g., outline: 2px solid with sufficient contrast) rather than removing the outline.

issues.description: Focus indicator removed for customized checkbox inputs in the checkout form.
issues.recommendation: Ensure customized inputs have visible focus states using :focus and/or :focus-visible with high-contrast outlines or box-shadows.

issues.description: Focus indicator removed for customized radio inputs in the payment section.
issues.recommendation: Provide visible focus styles for radio inputs (e.g., outline or box-shadow) and avoid removing outlines without replacement.

issues.description: Text color (#767676) on a light background likely fails the minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text (e.g., 14px).
issues.recommendation: Use a darker text color to achieve at least 4.5:1 contrast (e.g., #595858 or darker) or increase the text size/weight to qualify as large text.

issues.description: Text color (#767676) on a light background likely fails the minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal body text.
issues.recommendation: Choose a darker gray with sufficient contrast (e.g., #595858 or darker) or increase size/weight to meet large text criteria.

issues.description: Text color (#767676) on a light background likely fails the minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text.
issues.recommendation: Darken the text color to meet contrast requirements (e.g., #595858 or darker), or increase the font size and weight to treat it as large text.

issues.description: Non-interactive container styled with a pointer cursor suggests interactivity, which can misrepresent semantics and confuse users.
issues.recommendation: Remove cursor: pointer from non-interactive containers or apply it only to interactive elements like the button (.iconStyle).

issues.description: Automatically rotating 3D model cannot be paused, stopped, or hidden
issues.recommendation: Provide a control to pause/stop the rotation (e.g., a toggle button) and/or respect the prefers-reduced-motion media query to disable animation for users who request it

issues.description: The accessible name for the 3D preview is static and does not reflect the selected color change
issues.recommendation: Update the aria-label dynamically to include the selected color (e.g., aria-label={`3D t-shirt preview in ${tshirtColor}`}) or add an aria-live region announcing the currently selected color

issues.description: Link text is ambiguous and does not clearly describe its destination without additional context
issues.recommendation: Use a more descriptive link text such as "Shop the summer sale" or add an aria-label to the link to clarify its purpose (e.g., aria-label="Shop the summer sale")

issues.description: Heading element used purely for styling within a link, which can misrepresent document structure
issues.recommendation: Replace the h5 with a non-heading element (e.g., span) and apply styles via CSS, reserving heading elements for actual section headings

issues.description: Color selection relies on color alone with no additional visual indicator of the selected state for sighted users
issues.recommendation: Provide a non-color cue for selection, such as a checkmark icon, thicker/high-contrast border on the selected swatch, and/or visible text indicating the selected color (e.g., "Selected: Charcoal")

issues.description: Carousel auto-plays without a visible Pause/Stop control, making moving content difficult to stop for some users
issues.recommendation: Provide a keyboard-accessible Pause/Play toggle for the slider (e.g., a button with aria-pressed) or disable autoplay by default (or set disableOnInteraction: true)

issues.description: Wishlist state is conveyed by color alone (heart icon toggles between red and gray)
issues.recommendation: Do not rely on color alone; add an additional visual indicator (e.g., switch between outlined and filled heart icons, or add a 'Saved' text/indicator) while retaining aria-pressed for assistive technologies

issues.description: Low contrast text for category label (approx. 4.1:1 against white for 14px text), below the required 4.5:1
issues.recommendation: Increase text color contrast to at least 4.5:1 (e.g., use a darker gray like #595959 or #4d4d4d, or increase font weight/size appropriately)

issues.description: Low contrast text for reviews count (approx. 4.1:1 against white for 14px text), below the required 4.5:1
issues.recommendation: Use a higher-contrast color (e.g., #595959 or darker) or adjust typography so the contrast for normal-sized text meets 4.5:1

issues.description: aria-controls references a tab panel that may not exist in the DOM when this tab is inactive due to conditional rendering, breaking the relationship for assistive technologies
issues.recommendation: Keep all tab panels in the DOM and toggle visibility with the hidden attribute or aria-hidden and CSS, ensuring aria-controls always references an existing element; alternatively, adjust the tab pattern to maintain valid relationships at all times

issues.description: aria-controls references a tab panel that may not exist in the DOM when this tab is inactive due to conditional rendering, breaking the relationship for assistive technologies
issues.recommendation: Keep all tab panels in the DOM and toggle visibility with the hidden attribute or aria-hidden and CSS, ensuring aria-controls always references an existing element; alternatively, adjust the tab pattern to maintain valid relationships at all times

issues.description: aria-controls references a tab panel that may not exist in the DOM when this tab is inactive due to conditional rendering, breaking the relationship for assistive technologies
issues.recommendation: Keep all tab panels in the DOM and toggle visibility with the hidden attribute or aria-hidden and CSS, ensuring aria-controls always references an existing element; alternatively, adjust the tab pattern to maintain valid relationships at all times

issues.description: Custom checkbox removes the default focus indicator without providing a replacement, making keyboard focus not visible
issues.recommendation: Do not remove the focus outline without providing an alternative. Add a visible focus style for the checkbox, e.g., .userNewReviewFormCheck input:focus-visible { outline: 2px solid #000; outline-offset: 2px; } or a high-contrast box-shadow

issues.lineContent: setCurrentImg(0)} alt="Lightweight Puffer Jacket thumbnail 1" />
issues.description: Clickable image is not keyboard-accessible (onClick on non-interactive element without keyboard support)
issues.recommendation: Use a <button> element for thumbnails or add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space to activate; ensure a clear accessible name

issues.lineContent: setCurrentImg(1)} alt="Lightweight Puffer Jacket thumbnail 2" />
issues.description: Clickable image is not keyboard-accessible (onClick on non-interactive element without keyboard support)
issues.recommendation: Use a <button> element for thumbnails or add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space to activate; ensure a clear accessible name

issues.lineContent: setCurrentImg(2)} alt="Lightweight Puffer Jacket thumbnail 3" />
issues.description: Clickable image is not keyboard-accessible (onClick on non-interactive element without keyboard support)
issues.recommendation: Use a <button> element for thumbnails or add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space to activate; ensure a clear accessible name

issues.lineContent: setCurrentImg(3)} alt="Lightweight Puffer Jacket thumbnail 4" />
issues.description: Clickable image is not keyboard-accessible (onClick on non-interactive element without keyboard support)
issues.recommendation: Use a <button> element for thumbnails or add role="button", tabIndex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space to activate; ensure a clear accessible name

issues.description: Insufficient text contrast for small text (#767676 on white is below 4.5:1)
issues.recommendation: Use a darker color (e.g., #595959 or darker) or increase font size/weight to meet 4.5:1 contrast for normal text

issues.description: Star icons convey rating information without a text alternative
issues.recommendation: Provide an accessible text alternative (e.g., aria-label on a wrapper like "Rated 5 out of 5 stars" or include visually hidden text) and mark the star icons as aria-hidden="true"

issues.lineContent: <div className="rpImages" onClick={scrollToTop} role="button" tabIndex={0} aria-label="View product" onKeyDown={(e) => { if (e.key === "Enter" || e.key === " ") scrollToTop(); }}>
issues.description: Generic control label does not clearly describe the destination or purpose
issues.recommendation: Include the product name in the accessible label (e.g., aria-label={`View ${product.productName}`}) to make the purpose clear

issues.description: Decorative icon inside a labeled button may be announced by screen readers
issues.recommendation: Add aria-hidden="true" to the icon component or hide decorative icons from assistive technologies

issues.description: Decorative icon inside a labeled button may be announced by screen readers
issues.recommendation: Add aria-hidden="true" to the icon component or hide decorative icons from assistive technologies

issues.description: Decorative icon next to text link may be announced redundantly
issues.recommendation: Mark the decorative icon as aria-hidden="true" to prevent redundant announcements

issues.description: Decorative icon next to text link may be announced redundantly
issues.recommendation: Mark the decorative icon as aria-hidden="true" to prevent redundant announcements

issues.description: Decorative icon inside a text-labeled button may be announced redundantly
issues.recommendation: Add aria-hidden="true" to the decorative icon so screen readers rely on the button text

issues.description: Decorative icon next to text may be announced redundantly
issues.recommendation: Mark the decorative icon as aria-hidden="true" to avoid unnecessary verbosity

issues.description: Decorative icon inside an aria-labeled button may be announced by screen readers
issues.recommendation: Add aria-hidden="true" to the icon component so only the button’s aria-label is read

issues.description: Decorative icon inside an aria-labeled button may be announced by screen readers
issues.recommendation: Add aria-hidden="true" to the icon component so only the button’s aria-label is read

issues.description: Heading element used for non-heading content, which may confuse assistive technologies
issues.recommendation: Use a semantic element appropriate for its purpose (e.g., a <button> if interactive, or a <span> if purely decorative text)
